thread.title: Bonds: Treasuries fall as stock markets rally
thread.title_full: Bonds: Treasuries fall as stock markets rally

title: Bonds: Treasuries fall as stock markets rally
text:
Print 
  US Treasuries fell in early trade as investors bought back into equities and turned their attention towards a rate rise by the Federal Reserve as early as next month. 
The yield on the benchmark 10-year note rose six basis points to 2.23% as the Dow Jones Industrial Average rose 1.26% in early trade. 
Oil prices also rose with West Texas Intermediate Crude for September delivery up 1.66% to $44.59. Brent crude rose 2.41% to trade just below $50 a barrel. 
In the UK, bonds also fell, with 10-year gilt yields up seven basis points to 1.94%. Investors are looking towards a wage data report on Wednesday. 
Wage growth for the three months to June is expected to slow from May's 3.2% to 2.8% year on year as the bonus effect dissipates, the Financial Times reported. 
The unemployment rate, in the same release, is expected to remain at 5.6 %. 
German bunds joined the slide, with the 10-year yield up four basis points to 0.7%, while in Greece bond prices rose as the yields fell 65 basis points.
